tools.name: get_article_url
tools.description:
Retrieve the direct PDF URL of an article on arXiv.org by title or arXiv ID.

Args:
    title: Article title.
    arxiv_id: arXiv ID (e.g., 1706.03762 or arXiv:1706.03762v7).

Returns:
    URL that can be used to retrieve the article, or structured error JSON.

tools.name: download_article
tools.description:
Download the article as a PDF file. Resolve by arXiv ID or title.

Args:
    title: Article title.
    arxiv_id: arXiv ID.

Returns:
    Success message or structured error JSON.

tools.name: load_article_to_context
tools.description:
Load the article text into context. Supports title or arXiv ID resolution and partial extraction.

Args:
    title: Article title.
    arxiv_id: arXiv ID.
    start_page: 1-based start page (inclusive).
    end_page: 1-based end page (inclusive).
    max_pages: hard cap on number of pages to extract.
    max_chars: hard cap on number of characters to extract.
    preview: if True, only validate availability and return minimal info.

Returns:
    Article text or structured error JSON.

tools.name: get_details
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata of an article by title or arXiv ID.

Args:
    title: Article title.
    arxiv_id: arXiv ID.

Returns:
    JSON string containing article details or structured error JSON.

tools.name: search_arxiv
tools.description:
Performs a search query on the arXiv API based on specified parameters and returns matching article metadata.
This function allows for flexible querying of the arXiv database. Only parameters that are explicitly provided
will be included in the final search query. Results are returned in a JSON-formatted string with article titles
as keys and their corresponding arXiv IDs as values.

Args:
    all_fields: General keyword search across all metadata fields including title, abstract, authors, comments, and categories.
    title: Keyword(s) to search for within the titles of articles.
    author: Author name(s) to filter results by.
    abstract: Keyword(s) to search for within article abstracts.
    start: Index of the first result to return; used for paginating through search results. Defaults to 0.
    max_results: Maximum number of results to return (1-50).

Returns:
    A JSON-formatted string containing article titles and their associated arXiv IDs;
    otherwise, a structured error JSON string.

tools.name: memory_store
tools.description: Create memories with observations and relationships. **Pattern**: Search→Create→Connect. **Observations**: Self-contained context units (what/when/where/why/impact). **LocalIds**: Cross-references within THIS request only. **Limits**: 50 memories, 200 relations. **Quality**: Each observation = complete detective notes answering setting/action/actors/evidence/impact/significance.

name.description: Human-readable identifier. Be specific: 'OAuth2 Implementation' not 'Auth'. Include searchable keywords.

memoryType.description: Category: knowledge (facts), decision (choices), issue (problems), implementation (code), architecture (structure), pattern (recurring solutions), insight (discoveries).

localId.description: Temporary ID for relations within THIS request. Not reusable across operations. Format: short descriptive names.

observations.description: Context-rich narratives. Each = complete story with setting/action/actors/evidence/impact/significance. **One insight per session** - don't fragment thoughts.

metadata.description: Static properties (JSON). Use for: project, language, status, tags, dates, version. **Narrative content goes in observations**.

memories.description: Array of memories to create. **Always search first** to avoid duplicates. Each memory = one focused concept.

type.description: Relationship type: INFLUENCES, DEPENDS_ON, EXTENDS, IMPLEMENTS, CONTAINS, etc.

relations.description: Connect memories: from/to (localId or memoryId), type (semantic meaning), strength (0.1-1.0 importance).

validateReferences.description: Check all target IDs exist (default: true)

tools.name: memory_find
tools.description: Unified search/retrieval. **Query**: text, IDs array, or "*". **Context**: minimal (lists), full (everything), relations-only (graph). **Temporal**: createdAfter "7d"/"2024-01-15". **Graph**: traverseFrom + relations + depth. **Always search before creating**. Updates access timestamps for analytics.

query.description: Search text, array of memory IDs, or '*' for all. **Semantic search**: finds meaning, not just keywords.

limit.description: Max results (default: 10). **Increase for comprehensive searches** - use 50+ for full exploration.

memoryTypes.description: Filter by type array. **Leave empty for all types**. Common: ['knowledge', 'decision', 'implementation'].

includeContext.description: Detail level: **minimal** (id/name/type only - for lists), **full** (everything - default work mode), **relations-only** (graph analysis only).

threshold.description: Semantic match minimum (0.1-1.0). **Lower = more results**. 0.1 = permissive, 0.8 = strict matching.

createdAfter.description: Date filter. **ISO** ('2024-01-15') or **relative** ('7d', '30d', '3m', '1y'). Finds recent additions.

traverseFrom.description: Memory ID to start graph exploration. **Discovers connected knowledge** through relationships.

traverseRelations.description: Relation types to follow. **Empty = all types**. Common: ['INFLUENCES', 'DEPENDS_ON', 'IMPLEMENTS'].

maxDepth.description: Graph traversal depth (1-5, default: 2). **Higher = broader discovery**, but slower performance.

tools.name: memory_modify
tools.description: Update/delete memories, manage observations/relations. **Operations**: update (properties), delete (cascade), add-observations (append insights), create-relations (link existing). **Atomic**: All succeed or all fail. **Quality**: One substantial observation per session - complete context stories, not fragments.

target.description: Single memory ID to modify. **Use 'targets' for batch operations** to maintain atomicity.

changes.description: For update: new name/type/metadata. **Preserves existing observations** - use add-observations to append.

contents.description: For add: new observation text(s) - **typically one per session**. For delete: observation IDs to remove.

observations.description: For add-observations: new insights to append. **One substantial observation per session** - complete context stories.

type.description: Relationship type: INFLUENCES, DEPENDS_ON, EXTENDS, IMPLEMENTS, CONTAINS, etc.

relations.description: Relationships to create/update/delete between existing memories.

validateObservationIds.description: Validate observation IDs for delete (default: true)

tools.name: database_switch
tools.description: Switch active database context (creates if missing). ALL subsequent operations use this DB. Call once per session/project. Like 'cd' for memories. **Session-scoped**: Establishes context for entire workflow, not per-operation.

databaseName.description: Target database name. **Will be created if doesn't exist**. Use project names for isolation.

tools.name: search_cloudflare_documentation
tools.description:
Search the Cloudflare documentation.

		This tool should be used to answer any question about Cloudflare products or features, including:
		- Workers, Pages, R2, Images, Stream, D1, Durable Objects, KV, Workflows, Hyperdrive, Queues
		- AutoRAG, Workers AI, Vectorize, AI Gateway, Browser Rendering
		- Zero Trust, Access, Tunnel, Gateway, Browser Isolation, WARP, DDOS, Magic Transit, Magic WAN
		- CDN, Cache, DNS, Zaraz, Argo, Rulesets, Terraform, Account and Billing

		Results are returned as semantically similar chunks to the query.

area.description:
State/territory code or marine area code
This parameter is incompatible with the following parameters: point, region, region_type, zone

anyOf.description:
Marine area code as defined in NWS Directive 10-302:
* AM: Western North Atlantic Ocean and along U.S. East Coast south of Currituck Beach Light NC following the coastline into Gulf of Mexico to Ocean Reef FL including the Caribbean
* AN: Western North Atlantic Ocean and along U.S. East Coast from Canadian border south to Currituck Beach Light NC
* GM: Gulf of Mexico and along the U.S. Gulf Coast from the Mexican border to Ocean Reef FL
* LC: Lake St. Clair
* LE: Lake Erie
* LH: Lake Huron
* LM: Lake Michigan
* LO: Lake Ontario
* LS: Lake Superior
* PH: Central Pacific Ocean including Hawaiian waters
* PK: North Pacific Ocean near Alaska and along Alaska coastline including the Bering Sea and the Gulf of Alaska
* PM: Western Pacific Ocean including Mariana Island waters
* PS: South Central Pacific Ocean including American Samoa waters
* PZ: Eastern North Pacific Ocean and along U.S. West Coast from Canadian border to Mexican border
* SL: St. Lawrence River above St. Regis

point.description:
Point (latitude,longitude)
This parameter is incompatible with the following parameters: area, region, region_type, zone

region.description:
Marine region code
This parameter is incompatible with the following parameters: area, point, region_type, zone

items.description:
Marine region code. These are groups of marine areas combined.
* AL: Alaska waters (PK)
* AT: Atlantic Ocean (AM, AN)
* GL: Great Lakes (LC, LE, LH, LM, LO, LS, SL)
* GM: Gulf of Mexico (GM)
* PA: Eastern Pacific Ocean and U.S. West Coast (PZ)
* PI: Central and Western Pacific (PH, PM, PS)

region_type.description:

This parameter is incompatible with the following parameters: area, point, region, zone

zone.description:
Zone ID (forecast or county)
This parameter is incompatible with the following parameters: area, point, region, region_type

items.description:
UGC identifier for a NWS forecast zone or county.
The first two letters will correspond to either a state code or marine area code (see #/components/schemas/StateTerritoryCode and #/components/schemas/MarineAreaCode for lists of valid letter combinations).
The third letter will be Z for public/fire zone or C for county.

tools.name: query_technique
tools.description: Query ATT&CK technique details by exact technique ID or fuzzy technique name search. ID query returns full data for a single technique including ID, name, description, platforms, kill chain phases, references, and subtechniques. Name search returns a summary list of matching techniques with ID, name, and short description.

technique_id.description: The ATT&CK technique ID to query (e.g., 'T1059.001'). If provided, performs exact ID query first.

tech_name.description: Keyword for fuzzy search in ATT&CK technique names (e.g., 'phishing'). Used if no technique_id is provided.

tools.name: search_technique_full
tools.description: Query comprehensive details of ATT&CK techniques by exact ID or fuzzy name search. Returns full information for matching techniques, including ID, name, description, platforms, kill chain phases, references, subtechniques, and mitigations. ID query returns single technique; name search returns list with count.

technique_id.description: The ATT&CK technique ID for exact query (e.g., 'T1059.001'). Prioritized if provided.

tech_name.description: Keyword for fuzzy search in technique names.

tools.name: query_mitigations
tools.description: Query the list of mitigations related to a specific ATT&CK technique ID. Returns ID, name, and description for each applicable mitigation.

technique_id.description: The ATT&CK technique ID to query mitigations for (e.g., 'T1059.001'). Must be an exact match.

tools.name: query_detections
tools.description: Query detection methods or data components associated with an ATT&CK technique ID. Returns the source (data component name) and description for each relevant detection.

technique_id.description: The ATT&CK technique ID to query detections for (e.g., 'T1059.001'). Must be an exact match.

tools.name: find_awesome_section
tools.description:
Discovers sections/categories across awesome lists matching a search query and returns matching sections from awesome lists.

You MUST call this function before 'get_awesome_items' to discover available sections UNLESS the user explicitly provides a githubRepo or listId.

Selection Process:
1. Analyze the query to understand what type of resources the user is looking for
2. Return the most relevant matches based on:
   - Name similarity to the query and the awesome lists section
   - Category/section relevance of the awesome lists 
   - Number of items in the section
   - Confidence score

Response Format:
- Returns matching sections of the awesome lists with metadata
- Includes repository information, item counts, and confidence score
- Use the githubRepo or listId with relevant sections from results for get_awesome_items

For ambiguous queries, multiple relevant sections will be returned for the user to choose from.

query.description: Search terms for finding sections across awesome lists

limit.description: Maximum sections to return

tools.name: get_awesome_items
tools.description: Retrieves items from a specific awesome list or section with token limiting. You must call 'find_awesome_section' first to discover available sections, UNLESS the user explicitly provides a githubRepo or listId.

listId.description: UUID of the list (from find_awesome_section results)

githubRepo.description: GitHub repo path (e.g., 'sindresorhus/awesome') from find_awesome_section results

tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to return (default: 10000). Higher values provide more items but consume more tokens.

offset.description: Pagination offset for retrieving more items

tools.name: get_card_by_set_and_number
tools.description: 通过系列代码和收集编号获取单张卡牌。

tools.name: search_cards
tools.description:
通过查询字符串搜索卡牌，支持分页和排序。

**查询语法示例:**
- `t:creature c:r` (红色生物)
- `pow>=5 or mv<2` (力量大于等于5或法术力值小于2)
- `o:"draw a card" -c:u` (包含"抓一张牌"的非蓝色牌)
- `(t:instant or t:sorcery) mv<=3` (3费或以下的瞬间或法术)

**分页参数:**
- `page`: 页码 (整数, 默认 1)
- `page_size`: 每页数量 (整数, 默认 20, 最大 100)

**排序参数:**
- `order`: 按字段排序，逗号分隔。前缀 `-` 表示降序
  (例如: `name`, `-mv`, `name,-rarity`)
  默认排序: `name`

**其他参数:**
- `unique`: 去重方式 (id, oracle_id, illustration_id)
- `priority_chinese`: 是否优先显示中文卡牌

q.description: 查询字符串，例如 't:creature c:r'、'pow>=5 or mv<2'、's:TDM -t:creature'

order.description: 排序字段 (例如: name, -mv, rarity)

unique.description: 去重方式: id(不去重), oracle_id(按卡牌名去重), illustration_id(按插图去重)

priority_chinese.description: 是否优先显示中文卡牌 (默认 true)

parentTaskId.description: Optional parent task ID to limit search to direct children of this task. Use this to focus on a specific project or feature area.

status.description: Filter by task status. Options: 'pending' (not started), 'in-progress' (currently active), 'done' (completed), 'cancelled' (abandoned), 'archived' (stored). Most commonly used with 'pending' to find unstarted work.

priority.description: Filter by task priority level. Options: 'low', 'medium', 'high'. Higher priority tasks are automatically preferred when multiple options exist.

title.description: Brief, descriptive title for the task. Should clearly convey what needs to be accomplished.

description.description: Detailed description of the task, including context, requirements, or implementation notes. Optional but recommended for complex tasks.

parentTaskId.description: ID of an existing parent task to create this as a subtask. Use this to organize tasks hierarchically under projects or features.

priority.description: Task priority level affecting execution order. Options: 'low', 'medium' (default), 'high'. Higher priority tasks are worked on first.

status.description: Initial task status. Options: 'pending' (default, not started), 'in-progress' (currently active), 'done' (completed). Usually left as default 'pending'.

details.description: Additional implementation details, technical notes, or specific instructions for completing this task.

parentIndex.description: Zero-based array index of the parent task within this same batch. Use this instead of parentTaskId when the parent is being created in the same operation.

dependsOn.description: Array of zero-based indices of tasks within this batch that must be completed before this task can begin. Creates dependency relationships.

items.description: Individual task specification with all properties needed for creation

tasks.description: Array of task specifications to create. Tasks are processed in order, allowing later tasks to reference earlier ones by index.

statuses.description: Filter tasks by status array. Common values: 'pending' (unstarted), 'in-progress' (active), 'done' (completed), 'cancelled' (abandoned), 'archived' (stored). Leave empty to show pending and in-progress tasks only.

parentId.description: Filter to show only direct children of this parent task ID. Use this to explore a specific project or feature branch. Leave empty to include tasks at all levels.

includeProjectRoot.description: Whether to include project root tasks in the results. Set to true when you want to see top-level project containers.

taskId.description: ID of the existing task to add context information to. The task must already exist in the system.

title.description: Brief title for this context slice that summarizes the type of information being added (e.g., 'Implementation Approach', 'Research Findings').

description.description: Detailed content of the context slice. Can include research findings, implementation notes, complexity assessments, links, or any relevant information.

contextType.description: Category of context being added. Common types: 'implementation' (technical details), 'research' (findings/links), 'complexity' (assessment/risks), 'requirements' (clarifications), 'testing' (strategies), 'general' (miscellaneous notes).

dependentTaskId.description: ID of the task that depends on another task. This task will be blocked until its dependency is completed.

dependencyTaskId.description: ID of the task that must be completed first. This task must finish before the dependent task can begin.

taskId.description: ID of the existing task to update. The task must already exist in the system.

status.description: New status for the task. Options: 'pending' (not started), 'in-progress' (currently active), 'done' (completed), 'cancelled' (abandoned), 'archived' (stored).

cascade.description: Whether to cascade the status update to all descendant tasks. Only applies to final statuses like 'done', 'cancelled', or 'archived'.

tools.name: start_evolution
tools.description:
Initialize an evolutionary solution system for a given problem with consistency checks.

This tool sets up the framework for evolving solutions across multiple generations. The LLM will:
1. Generate initial population of solutions
2. Evaluate solutions against consistency checks
3. Use crossover recommendations to create better solutions
4. Repeat until convergence or max generations

Use this tool to begin the evolutionary process with a clear problem statement and evaluation criteria.

problemStatement.description: The problem or challenge to solve

consistencyChecks.description: Array of consistency checks (strings or objects with description and weight)

tools.name: add_solution
tools.description:
Add a new solution to the current generation of the evolutionary system.

Use this tool to contribute solutions to the current generation. Solutions can be:
- Initial solutions (generation 0)
- Evolved solutions based on crossover recommendations
- Variations or mutations of existing solutions

The solution content should directly address the problem statement.

content.description: The solution content addressing the problem statement

parentSolutions.description: Optional array of parent solution IDs if this is a crossover

tools.name: score_solution
tools.description:
Score a solution against a specific consistency check.

Use this tool to evaluate how well a solution performs against each consistency check.
Scores should be between 0.0 (poor) and 1.0 (excellent).

The LLM should evaluate the solution content against the consistency check description and provide an objective score.

solutionId.description: ID of the solution to score

checkId.description: ID of the consistency check to evaluate against

reasoning.description: Optional explanation of the scoring rationale

tools.name: evolve_generation
tools.description:
Evolve to the next generation using crossover analysis.

This tool analyzes the current generation's performance and provides crossover recommendations.
It identifies the best-performing solution for each consistency check and suggests how to combine
these aspects into new solutions for the next generation.

Use this after all solutions in the current generation have been fully scored.

tools.name: get_evolution_status
tools.description:
Get the current status of the evolutionary system.

Returns detailed information about the current state including:
- Current generation and progress
- Population statistics
- Best solution found so far
- Evolution history

Use this tool to track progress and understand the current state of the evolution.

tools.description:
Get components from the current document, a team library, or remote team libraries.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the components info as JSON.

source.description: The source to get components from: 'local' (current document), 'team' (team library), or 'remote' (remote team library).

team_id.description: The team ID to use when the source is 'team' or 'remote'.

page_size.description: The number of components to return per page.

after.description: A cursor for pagination, indicating where to start the next page.

tools.name: set_variant
tools.description:
Create, add, rename, delete, organize, or batch create variants/properties in a component set (single or batch).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

componentSetId.description: The ID of the component set to operate on.

action.description: The action to perform on the component set.

properties.description: Additional properties for the variant operation.

variantId.description: The ID of the specific variant to modify (if applicable).

propertyName.description: The name of the property to rename or modify.

newPropertyName.description: The new name for the property (if renaming).

propertyValue.description: The value of the property to set or update.

newPropertyValue.description: The new value for the property (if changing).

templateComponentId.description: The ID of a template component to use for batch creation.

propertiesList.description: A list of property objects for batch operations.

variant.description: A single variant operation to perform.

variants.description: An array of variant operations to perform in batch.

tools.name: get_variant
tools.description:
Get info about variants/properties for one or more component sets.

Returns: For single: { componentSetId, variants: [...] }, for batch: Array<{ componentSetId, variants: [...] }>.

componentSetId.description: The ID of a single component set to query.

componentSetIds.description: An array of component set IDs to query in batch.

tools.name: create_component_instance
tools.description:
Creates one or more component instances in Figma. Accepts either a single entry (via 'entry') or an array of entries (via 'entries').

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created instance IDs.

componentKey.description: The unique key of the component to instantiate.

x.description: The X coordinate for the instance on the Figma canvas.

y.description: The Y coordinate for the instance on the Figma canvas.

entry.description: A single component instance creation entry.

entries.description: An array of component instance creation entries for batch creation.

tools.name: create_components_from_node
tools.description:
Converts one or more existing nodes into components in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains:
      - type: "text"
      - text: JSON string with created component IDs and any errors.

nodeId.description: The Figma node ID to convert into a component.

maintain_position.description: Whether to maintain the node's position after conversion.

entries.description: An array of node-to-component conversion entries for batch conversion.

skip_errors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining entries.

nodeId.description: A single Figma node ID to select.

nodeIds.description: An array of Figma node IDs to select.

inputSchema.description: Input schema for the set_selection command. Provide either 'nodeId' or 'nodeIds'.

tools.name: get_selection
tools.description:
Get information about the current selection in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the selection info as JSON.

newPageName.description: Optional name for the new page.

tools.description:
Get detailed information about the current Figma document.

Returns:

tools.name: get_doc_pages

Get information about all pages in the current Figma document.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the pages info as JSON.

tools.name: export_node_as_image
tools.description:
Exports a node as an image from Figma in the specified format and scale.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains type: "image", data (image data), and mimeType (image mime type).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to export. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

format.description: Optional. The image format to export: "PNG", "JPG", "SVG", or "PDF". Defaults to "PNG" if omitted.

scale.description: Optional. The export scale factor. Must be a positive number. Defaults to 1 if omitted.

tools.name: get_html
tools.description:
Generates HTML structure from Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the generated HTML string.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to generate HTML from. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

format.description: Optional. The HTML output format: "semantic", "div-based", or "webcomponent". Defaults to "semantic".

cssMode.description: Optional. The CSS handling mode: "inline", "classes", or "external". Defaults to "classes".

tools.name: get_css_async
tools.description:
Get CSS properties from a node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the CSS properties as JSON.

nodeId.description: Optional. The unique Figma node ID to get CSS from. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

format.description: Optional. The format to return CSS in: "object", "string", or "inline".

tools.name: set_image
tools.description:
Sets or inserts one or more images into Figma. Each image can be specified by a remote URL, a local file path, or a base64 data URI. Accepts either a single image config (via 'image') or an array of configs (via 'images'). You can customize size, name, and parent node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the inserted image node ID(s).

url.description: Optional. The URL of the image to insert. Must be a valid URL.

imagePath.description: Optional. Path to the local image file. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 500 characters.

imageData.description: Optional. Base64 data URI of the image. If provided, must be a non-empty string.

x.description: Optional. X coordinate for the image. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

y.description: Optional. Y coordinate for the image. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

width.description: Optional. Width of the image. Must be between 1 and 10,000.

height.description: Optional. Height of the image. Must be between 1 and 10,000.

name.description: Optional. Name for the image node. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

parentId.description: Optional. Figma node ID of the parent. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

image.description: A single image configuration object. Each object should include at least one of url, imagePath, or imageData, plus optional coordinates and properties.

images.description: An array of image configuration objects. Each object should include at least one of url, imagePath, or imageData, plus optional coordinates and properties.

tools.name: set_corner_radius
tools.description:
Sets the corner radius of a node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the updated node's ID.

radius.description: The corner radius to set, in pixels. Must be a non-negative number.

corners.description: Optional array of four booleans indicating which corners to apply the radius to, in order: [top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left].

tools.name: move_node
tools.description:
Moves one or more nodes to a new position in Figma. Accepts either a single move config (via 'move') or an array of configs (via 'moves').

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the moved node ID(s) and new position(s).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to move. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

x.description: New X position. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

y.description: New Y position. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

moves.description: An array of node move operations for batch movement.

tools.name: resize_node
tools.description:
Resize a node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the resized node's ID and new size.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to resize. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

width.description: The new width for the node, in pixels. Must be a positive number between 1 and 10,000.

height.description: The new height for the node, in pixels. Must be a positive number between 1 and 10,000.

tools.name: rotate_node
tools.description:
Rotate a node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the rotated node's ID, angle, and pivot info.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to rotate.

angle.description: The rotation angle in degrees. Positive is clockwise.

pivot.description: The pivot point for rotation. Defaults to 'center'.

x.description: X coordinate of the custom pivot point (absolute coordinates).

y.description: Y coordinate of the custom pivot point (absolute coordinates).

pivotPoint.description: Custom pivot point coordinates. Required if pivot is 'custom'.

tools.name: set_auto_layout_resizing
tools.description:
Sets hug or fill sizing mode on an auto layout frame or child node in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the updated node's ID.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

axis.description: The axis to set sizing mode for: "horizontal" or "vertical".

mode.description: The sizing mode to set: "FIXED", "HUG", or "FILL".

tools.name: detach_instances
tools.description:
Detaches one or more Figma component instances from their masters.
Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the detached instance's ID or error info.

instanceId.description: A single Figma instance ID to detach.

instanceIds.description: An array of Figma instance IDs to detach in batch.

maintain_position.description: If true, maintain the position of the instance after detaching.

skip_errors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining instances.

tools.name: set_node_prop
tools.description: Sets node properties (locked, visible, etc.) for one or more nodes.

tools.name: set_auto_layout
tools.description:
Set, update, or delete one or more layout grids on Figma nodes (FRAME, COMPONENT, INSTANCE).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to update.

mode.description: The auto layout mode to set: "HORIZONTAL", "VERTICAL", or "NONE".

layoutWrap.description: The layout wrap mode: "NO_WRAP" or "WRAP". Optional.

itemSpacing.description: Spacing between items in pixels. Optional.

padding.description: Padding object with top, right, bottom, left properties. Optional.

tools.name: set_constraint
tools.description:
Set constraints (left/right/top/bottom/center/scale/stretch) for one or more Figma nodes.

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

nodeId.description: The ID of the node to apply constraints to.

constraint.description: A single constraint entry to apply.

constraints.description: An array of constraint entries to apply in batch.

applyToChildren.description: If true, apply constraints to all children of the node(s).

maintainAspectRatio.description: If true, maintain the aspect ratio when applying constraints.

tools.name: get_constraint
tools.description:
Get constraints for one or more Figma nodes (optionally including children).

Returns: Array of constraint info for each node, including children if requested.

nodeId.description: The ID of a single node to get constraints for.

nodeIds.description: An array of node IDs to get constraints for in batch.

includeChildren.description: If true, include constraints for all children of the node(s).

tools.name: subscribe_event
tools.description:
Subscribe or unsubscribe to a Figma event (e.g., selection_change, document_change).

Returns: { subscriptionId } for subscribe, { success: true } for unsubscribe

tools.name: create_button
tools.description:
Creates a complete button with background and text in Figma at the specified coordinates. You can customize size, text, colors, font, corner radius, name, and parent node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created button's frame, background, and text node IDs.

x.description: The X coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

y.description: The Y coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

width.description: The width of the button in pixels.

height.description: The height of the button in pixels.

text.description: The text label for the button.

background.description: The background color of the button as RGBA.

textColor.description: The text color of the button as RGBA.

fontSize.description: The font size for the button text.

fontWeight.description: The font weight for the button text.

cornerRadius.description: The corner radius for the button.

name.description: The name to assign to the button node.

parentId.description: The parent node ID to attach the button to.

x.description: The X coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

y.description: The Y coordinate for the button on the Figma canvas.

width.description: The width of the button in pixels.

height.description: The height of the button in pixels.

text.description: The text label for the button.

background.description: The background color of the button as RGBA.

textColor.description: The text color of the button as RGBA.

fontSize.description: The font size for the button text.

fontWeight.description: The font weight for the button text.

cornerRadius.description: The corner radius for the button.

name.description: The name to assign to the button node.

parentId.description: The parent node ID to attach the button to.

items.description: A single button creation entry.

buttons.description: An array of button creation entries for batch creation.

tools.name: set_variable
tools.description:
Creates, updates, or deletes one or more Figma Variables (design tokens).

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result or summary.

variables.description: One or more variable definitions to create or update. Can be a single object or an array.

ids.description: One or more variable IDs to delete. Can be a single string or an array of strings.

tools.name: get_annotation
tools.description:
Get annotation(s) for one or more Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - For single: { nodeId, annotations }
  - For batch: Array<{ nodeId, annotations }>

nodeId.description: The ID of a single node to get annotations for. Optional.

nodeIds.description: An array of node IDs to get annotations for in batch. Optional.

tools.name: set_annotation
tools.description:
Set, update, or delete annotation(s) for one or more Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - For single: { nodeId, updated/deleted }
  - For batch: Array<{ nodeId, updated/deleted }>

entry.description: A single annotation operation to perform. Optional.

entries.description: An array of annotation operations to perform in batch. Optional.

tools.name: boolean
tools.description:
Perform boolean operations (union, subtract, intersect, exclude) on Figma nodes.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result.

tools.name: group_node
tools.description:
Groups or ungroups nodes in Figma, depending on the 'group' flag.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result.

group.description: If true, group nodes; if false, ungroup a group node.

items.description: A Figma node ID. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

nodeIds.description: Array of node IDs. Must contain at least 2 and at most 100 items.

name.description: Optional. Name for the group. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma group node ID to ungroup. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

tools.name: delete_node
tools.description:
Deletes one or more nodes in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the deleted node's ID(s).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to delete. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

items.description: A Figma node ID. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

nodeIds.description: Array of node IDs. Must contain at least 1 and at most 100 items.

tools.name: set_node
tools.description:
Sets or inserts one or more child nodes into parent nodes at optional index positions in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the parentId, childId, index, success status, and any error message.

parentId.description: ID of the parent node

childId.description: ID of the child node to insert

parentId.description: ID of the parent node

childId.description: ID of the child node to insert

operations.description: An array of set/insert operations to perform in batch. Optional.

skipErrors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining operations in batch mode.

options.description: Options for the operation (e.g., skipErrors). Optional.

tools.name: flatten_node
tools.description:
Flatten one or more nodes in Figma, or the current selection, merging all child vector layers and shapes into a single vector layer.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the results for each node.

nodeId.description: ID of the node to flatten. Must be a Frame, Group, or node that supports flattening.

nodeIds.description: Array of Figma node IDs to flatten. Must contain 1 to 100 items.

selection.description: If true, use the current Figma selection for the operation. If true, nodeId and nodeIds are ignored.

tools.name: duplicate_node
tools.description:
Clones one or more nodes in Figma. Accepts either a single node config (via 'node') or an array of configs (via 'nodes'). Optionally, you can specify positions, offsets, and parent.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the new node ID(s).

nodeId.description: ID of the node to clone.

x.description: X coordinate for the new node's position.

y.description: Y coordinate for the new node's position.

position.description: Optional absolute position for the cloned node.

offsetX.description: Optional X offset to apply to the cloned node's position.

offsetY.description: Optional Y offset to apply to the cloned node's position.

parentId.description: Optional parent node ID to attach the cloned node to.

node.description: A single node clone configuration. Optional.

nodes.description: An array of node clone configurations for batch cloning. Optional.

tools.name: rename_layer
tools.description:
Renames one or more nodes in Figma. Accepts either a single rename config (via 'rename') or an array of configs (via 'renames').

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the original and new name(s).

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to rename. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

newName.description: The new name for the node. Must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

rename.description: A single rename configuration object. Optional.

renames.description: An array of rename configuration objects for batch renaming. Optional.

tools.name: reorder_node
tools.description:
Reorders one or more nodes in their parents' children arrays. Accepts either a single reorder config (via 'reorder') or an array of configs (via 'reorders'). Optionally, you can provide options such as skip_errors.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the results and any errors.

nodeId.description: The ID of the node to reorder.

direction.description: The direction to move the node: 'up', 'down', 'front', or 'back'. Optional.

index.description: The new index to move the node to (0-based). Optional.

reorder.description: A single reorder configuration object. Each object should include nodeId and optional direction or index.

skip_errors.description: If true, skip errors and continue processing remaining operations in batch mode.

options.description: Options for the operation (e.g., skip_errors). Optional.

tools.name: get_node_info
tools.description:
Get detailed information about one or more nodes in Figma.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the node(s) info as JSON.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to get information about. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

items.description: A Figma node ID. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

nodeIds.description: An array of Figma node IDs to get information about. Each must be a string in the format '123:456'.

tools.name: set_matrix_transform
tools.description:
Set a transformation matrix on one or more Figma nodes (single or batch).

Parameters:
  - entry: { nodeId: string, matrix: number[] } (optional, for single)
  - entries: Array<{ nodeId: string, matrix: number[] }> (optional, for batch)
  - options: { skipErrors?: boolean } (optional)

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the result for each node.

tools.name: set_grid
tools.description:
Create, update, or delete one or more layout grids on Figma nodes (FRAME, COMPONENT, INSTANCE).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

tools.name: get_grid
tools.description:
Get all layout grids for one or more Figma nodes (FRAME, COMPONENT, INSTANCE).

Returns: For single: { nodeId, grids: [...] }, for batch: Array<{ nodeId, grids: [...] }>.

tools.name: set_guide
tools.description:
Add or delete one or more guides on the current Figma page.

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

tools.name: get_guide
tools.description:
Get all guides on the current Figma page.

Returns: Array of guides, each with { axis, offset }

tools.name: set_page
tools.description:
Create, delete, rename, or set current page (single or batch).

Returns: Array of result objects for each operation.

tools.name: get_page
tools.description:
Get info for one, many, or all pages.

Returns: For single: { pageId, name, isActive }, for batch: Array<{ pageId, name, isActive }>.

tools.name: create_rectangle
tools.description:
Creates one or more rectangle shape nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single rectangle config (via 'rectangle') or an array of configs (via 'rectangles'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID to attach the rectangle(s) to, and a corner radius for rounded corners.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created rectangle node ID(s).

x.description: The X coordinate (in Figma canvas units, pixels) for the top-left corner of the rectangle. Must be >= 0. Example: 100

y.description: The Y coordinate (in Figma canvas units, pixels) for the top-left corner of the rectangle. Must be >= 0. Example: 200

width.description: The width of the rectangle in pixels. Must be > 0. Example: 300

height.description: The height of the rectangle in pixels. Must be > 0. Example: 150

name.description: The name to assign to the rectangle node in Figma. Example: 'Button Background'

parentId.description: The Figma node ID of the parent to attach the rectangle to. If omitted, the rectangle is added to the root.

cornerRadius.description: The corner radius (in pixels) for rounded corners. Must be >= 0. Example: 8

fillColor.description: Optional RGBA fill color for the rectangle. Example: { r: 0.2235, g: 1, b: 0.0784, a: 1 }

strokeColor.description: Optional RGBA stroke color for the rectangle. Example: { r: 0, g: 0, b: 0, a: 1 }

strokeWeight.description: Optional stroke weight for the rectangle.

rectangle.description: A single rectangle configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a rectangle.

rectangles.description: An array of rectangle configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a rectangle.

tools.name: create_frame
tools.description:
Creates one or more frame nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single frame config (via 'frame') or an array of configs (via 'frames'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID, fill color, stroke color, stroke weight, and corner radius.

Corner radius can be:
- A single number for uniform corners (e.g., 8)
- An array of 4 numbers for individual corners [topLeft, topRight, bottomRight, bottomLeft] (e.g., [8, 8, 0, 0])

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created frame node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 50

y.description: Y coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 100

height.description: Height in pixels. Example: 300

name.description: Name for the frame node. Example: 'Main Frame'

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

anyOf.description: Uniform corner radius for all corners. Example: 8
Individual corner radii [topLeft, topRight, bottomRight, bottomLeft]. Example: [8, 8, 0, 0]

cornerRadius.description: Corner radius configuration. Use a single number for uniform corners or array of 4 numbers for individual corner control.

frame.description: A single frame configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a frame including corner radius.

frames.description: An array of frame configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a frame including corner radius.

tools.name: create_line
tools.description:
Creates one or more line nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single line config (via 'line') or an array of configs (via 'lines'). Optionally, you can provide a parent node ID, stroke color, and stroke weight.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created line node ID(s).

x1.description: X coordinate for the start point. Example: 10

y1.description: Y coordinate for the start point. Example: 20

x2.description: X coordinate for the end point. Example: 110

y2.description: Y coordinate for the end point. Example: 20

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

line.description: A single line configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a line.

lines.description: An array of line configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a line.

tools.name: create_ellipse
tools.description:
Creates one or more ellipse nodes in the specified Figma document. Accepts either a single ellipse config (via 'ellipse') or an array of configs (via 'ellipses'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID, fill color, stroke color, and stroke weight.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created ellipse node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 60

y.description: Y coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 80

height.description: Height in pixels. Example: 90

name.description: Name for the ellipse node. Example: 'Ellipse1'

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

ellipse.description: A single ellipse configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for an ellipse.

ellipses.description: An array of ellipse configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for an ellipse.

tools.name: create_polygon
tools.description:
Creates one or more polygons in Figma. Accepts either a single polygon config (via 'polygon') or an array of configs (via 'polygons'). Optionally, you can provide a name, a parent node ID, fill color, stroke color, and stroke weight.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created polygon node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 10

y.description: Y coordinate for the top-left corner. Example: 20

height.description: Height in pixels. Example: 100

parentId.description: Figma node ID of the parent.

polygon.description: A single polygon configuration object. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a polygon.

polygons.description: An array of polygon configuration objects. Each object should include coordinates, dimensions, and optional properties for a polygon.

targetNodeId.description: ID of the node to be masked

maskNodeId.description: ID of the node to use as mask

items.description: Red channel (0-1)
Green channel (0-1)
Blue channel (0-1)
Alpha channel (0-1)

Set effect(s) directly or by style variable on one or more nodes in Figma.

Get all styles from the current Figma document.

svg.description: A single SVG vector configuration. Optional.

x.description: Optional. X coordinate for the SVG. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000. Defaults to 0.

name.description: Optional. Name for the SVG node. If provided, must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

Get text segments with specific styling in a text node.

Scan all text nodes in the selected Figma node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the scan status and results.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma node ID to scan. Must be a string in the format '123:456'.

tools.name: set_text_content
tools.description:
Sets the text content of one or more text nodes in Figma.
Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the update result.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma text node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

text.description: The new text content to set for the node. Must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 10,000 characters.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma child text node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

text.description: The new text content to set for the child node. Must be a non-empty string. Maximum length 10,000 characters.

texts.description: Array of objects specifying nodeId and text for each child text node to update. Must contain 1 to 100 items.

tools.name: set_text_style
tools.description:
Sets one or more text style properties (font, size, weight, spacing, case, decoration, etc.) on one or more nodes in Figma.
Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the update result.

nodeId.description: The unique Figma text node ID to update. Must be a string in the format '123:456' or a complex instance ID like 'I422:10713;1082:2236'.

fontSize.description: Font size in pixels. Must be between 1 and 200.

fontWeight.description: Font weight. Must be between 100 and 1000.

anyOf.description: Font name object with family and style

fontName.description: Font name as string (family name) or object with family and style

letterSpacing.description: Letter spacing with value and unit

anyOf.description: Line height as multiplier (e.g., 1.6)
Line height with value and unit

lineHeight.description: Line height as number or object with value and unit

paragraphSpacing.description: Paragraph spacing in pixels. Must be between 0 and 1000.

fontColor.description: Font color as RGBA object - implemented via fills property

fills.description: Array of fill objects - fully supported by Plugin API

textAlignHorizontal.description: Horizontal text alignment - Plugin API supported

textAlignVertical.description: Vertical text alignment - Plugin API supported

textAutoResize.description: Text auto-resize behavior - Plugin API supported with 4 options

textTruncation.description: Text truncation behavior - Plugin API supported

maxLines.description: Maximum number of lines for text truncation - only works when textTruncation is 'ENDING'

styles.description: Text style properties object - includes all Figma Plugin API supported properties (updated with corrected truncation support)

items.description: A single text style update entry with nodeId and styles

entries.description: Array of text style update entries. Must contain 1 to 100 items.

tools.name: set_text
tools.description:
Creates one or more text elements in Figma. Accepts either a single text config (via 'text') or an array of configs (via 'texts').
If 'width' and 'height' are provided, creates a bounded text box; otherwise, creates a regular text node.

Returns:
  - content: Array of objects. Each object contains a type: "text" and a text field with the created text node ID(s).

x.description: X coordinate for the text element. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

y.description: Y coordinate for the text element. Must be between -10,000 and 10,000.

text.description: The text content. Must be a non-empty string up to 10,000 characters.

width.description: Optional. Width of the text box. If provided, creates a bounded text box. Must be between 1 and 2000.

height.description: Optional. Height of the text box. If provided, creates a bounded text box. Must be between 1 and 2000.

fontSize.description: Optional. Font size. Must be between 1 and 200.

fontWeight.description: Optional. Font weight. Must be between 100 and 1000.

name.description: Name for the text node. Must be a non-empty string up to 100 characters.

parentId.description: Optional. Figma node ID of the parent. If provided, must be a string in the format '123:456'.

text.description: A single text element configuration. Optional.

texts.description: Array of text configurations for batch creation
An array of text element configurations for batch creation. Optional.

tools.name: get_server_info
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get MySQL server version and basic information

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show MySQL server version, edition, and compilation info
- Display server uptime and basic configuration
- Show available storage engines and default engine
- Provide server connection details (sanitized)

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "server info", "MySQL version", "server status"
- When diagnosing compatibility issues
- When checking server capabilities

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)

Returns:
    Formatted string with MySQL server information

tools.name: get_active_connections
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Monitor active MySQL connections and processes

[Exact Functionality]:
- List all active connections with process ID, user, host, database
- Show current command being executed by each connection
- Display connection time and state information
- Filter by user or database name

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "active connections", "current sessions", "process list"
- When diagnosing connection issues or monitoring user activity
- When checking for long-running queries

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)
    user_filter: Filter connections by username
    db_filter: Filter connections by database name

Returns:
    Formatted string with active connection information

tools.name: get_database_list
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: List all databases in MySQL server

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show all databases with names and character sets
- Display database size information if available
- Show collation and default character set

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "database list", "show databases", "available databases"
- When exploring server structure

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)

Returns:
    Formatted string with database list

tools.name: get_table_list
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: List all tables in specified database or all databases

[Exact Functionality]:
- If database_name provided: Show tables in that specific database
- If database_name empty: Show tables from all user databases with database names
- Display table type (BASE TABLE, VIEW), engine, rows count, and size information
- Show creation and update timestamps
- Filter by table type if specified

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "table list", "show tables", "database tables"
- When exploring database structure

Args:
    database_name: Database name to analyze (if empty, shows tables from all databases)
    table_type: Filter by table type ("BASE TABLE", "VIEW")

Returns:
    Formatted string with table information

tools.name: get_table_schema_info
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get detailed schema information for a specific table or entire database

[Exact Functionality]:
- If table_name provided: Show all columns, indexes, foreign keys for that table
- If table_name empty: Show overview of all tables in the database
- Display table statistics, constraints, and engine information
- Include column comments and default values

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "table schema", "table structure", "describe table"
- When analyzing table design and constraints
- When requesting database-wide schema analysis with empty table_name

Args:
    table_name: Name of the table to analyze (empty string for database overview)
    database_name: Database containing the table (uses current database if omitted)

Returns:
    Formatted string with detailed table schema information or database overview

tools.name: get_mysql_config
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get MySQL server configuration variables

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show server configuration variables and their values
- Filter by search term if provided
- Display both global and session variables
- Show variable descriptions where available

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "MySQL config", "server variables", "configuration"
- When diagnosing configuration issues
- When checking specific settings

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)
    search_term: Filter variables by name containing this term

Returns:
    Formatted string with MySQL configuration

tools.name: get_user_list
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: List all MySQL users and their privileges

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show all MySQL users with their host patterns
- Display account status and authentication info
- Show password expiration and locking status
- Include SSL and resource limit information

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "user list", "MySQL users", "account info"
- When managing user access and security
- When auditing user accounts

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)

Returns:
    Formatted string with user account information

tools.name: get_server_status
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get MySQL server status variables and performance counters

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show server status variables with current values
- Display performance counters and operational metrics
- Filter by search term if provided
- Include connection, query, and resource statistics

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "server status", "MySQL status", "performance metrics"
- When monitoring server health and performance
- When diagnosing operational issues

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)
    search_term: Filter status variables by name containing this term

Returns:
    Formatted string with server status information

tools.name: get_table_size_info
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get table size information and storage analysis

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show table sizes with data and index breakdown
- Display size ratios and storage efficiency
- Order by total size (largest first)
- Include row counts and average row sizes

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "table sizes", "largest tables", "storage analysis"
- When planning database optimization
- When monitoring storage usage

Args:
    database_name: Database name to analyze (uses current database if omitted, shows all if none)
    limit: Maximum number of tables to return (default: 20)

Returns:
    Formatted string with table size information

tools.name: get_database_size_info
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get database size information and storage distribution

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show database sizes with table counts
- Display total, data, and index size breakdown
- Compare databases by storage usage
- Include average table sizes

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "database sizes", "storage usage", "database capacity"
- When planning database resources
- When monitoring growth trends

Args:
    database_name: Specific database name to analyze (analyzes all databases if omitted)

Returns:
    Formatted string with database size information

tools.name: get_index_usage_stats
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get index usage statistics and efficiency analysis

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show index information with cardinality and selectivity
- Display index types and usage patterns
- Identify potentially unused or inefficient indexes
- Order by cardinality and selectivity metrics

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "index stats", "index analysis", "index optimization"
- When optimizing query performance
- When identifying redundant indexes

Args:
    database_name: Database name to analyze (uses current database if omitted)
    limit: Maximum number of indexes to return (default: 20)

Returns:
    Formatted string with index usage statistics

tools.name: get_connection_info
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get current connection and process information

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show active connections with detailed process information
- Display connection duration, state, and current operations
- Include user, host, and database context for each connection
- Filter out system processes for clarity

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "connection info", "active processes", "session details"
- When monitoring database activity and user sessions
- When diagnosing connection issues

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)

Returns:
    Formatted string with connection information

tools.name: get_slow_queries
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get slow queries from Performance Schema

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show slowest queries with execution statistics
- Display query text, execution count, and timing information
- Show rows examined and returned
- Order by total execution time

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "slow queries", "performance analysis", "query optimization"
- When diagnosing performance issues
- When identifying problematic queries

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)
    limit: Maximum number of queries to return (default: 20)

Returns:
    Formatted string with slow query information

tools.name: get_table_io_stats
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get table I/O statistics from Performance Schema

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show I/O statistics for tables including reads, writes, and timing
- Display fetch, insert, update, delete operations
- Order by total I/O time
- Show both request counts and timing information

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "table I/O", "table performance", "I/O statistics"
- When analyzing table access patterns
- When identifying heavily used tables

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)
    limit: Maximum number of tables to return (default: 20)

Returns:
    Formatted string with table I/O statistics

tools.name: get_lock_monitoring
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Monitor current locks in MySQL

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show current lock information from Performance Schema
- Display lock types, modes, and status
- Show which sessions are holding or waiting for locks
- Include query information for lock holders

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "lock monitoring", "deadlock check", "blocked sessions"
- When diagnosing locking issues
- When checking for lock contention

Args:
    database_name: Database name to connect to (uses default if omitted)

Returns:
    Formatted string with lock monitoring information

tools.name: get_current_database_info
tools.description:
[Tool Purpose]: Get information about the currently connected or specified database

[Exact Functionality]:
- Show database name, character set, and collation
- Display database size and table count
- Show creation time if available
- Include storage engine distribution

[Required Use Cases]:
- When user requests "current database", "database info", "database details"
- When getting context about the working database

Args:
    database_name: Database name to analyze (uses current database if omitted, shows available databases if none)

Returns:
    Formatted string with database information or available databases

tools.name: exa_docs

Access Exa.ai's complete documentation, code examples, and interactive tutorials through a single unified tool. This simplifies usage by providing all documentation operations in one place instead of multiple separate tools.

Available operations:
- Documentation: get_docs, search_docs
- Examples: list_examples, get_example, search_examples  
- Integrations: get_integration, list_integrations, search_integrations
- Websets: get_websets_docs, search_websets
- Changelog: get_changelog, get_latest_changes, search_changes

query.description: Keywords to search across documentation
Keywords to search within examples
Keywords to search within integrations

tools.name: get_learning_pathway
tools.description:
Return a personalized secure code learning pathway based on github or secdim profile context.

    Use this tool to:
    - Analyze GitHub profile to understand developer's experience and provide a personilized learning path
    - Analyze SecDim profile to understand developer's experience and provide a personilized learning path
    - Provide important resources and link to secure code learning labs on how to fix specific vulnerabilities
    - Teach developer how to patch a specific vulnerability
    - Provide a series of hands-on labs to practice secure coding
    - Create a personalized learning path for secure coding practices

    When secdim_username is provided, the tool will:
    - Fetch player profile from /player/{username}/activity API
    - Fetch completed challenges from /player/{username}/completed API
    - Filter out challenges the user has already completed
    - Use player skill data to better match language and technology recommendations
    - Estimate experience level based on challenge completion history

    The tool will provide error feedback if:
    - No suitable challenges were found for the requested language
    - The main vulnerability was not provided or had no matching labs
    - The user has completed a large number of challenges (50+)
    - There was an issue analyzing either GitHub or SecDim profiles

    Args:
        language: Programming language (e.g., 'javascript', 'python')
        vulnerability: The vulnerability to focus on (e.g., 'xss', 'sql-injection')
        experience_level: Developer experience level (default: beginner)
        github_username: GitHub username for profile analysis (at least one of github_username or secdim_username is required)
        secdim_username: SecDim username for profile analysis (at least one of github_username or secdim_username is required)
        github_token: GitHub token for API access (optional)

    Returns:
        Dictionary containing the learning pathway or error

tools.name: get_vulnerable_practice_labs
tools.description:
Return a list of hands-on SecDim secure coding labs related to a detected or suspected vulnerability.

    Use this tool to:
    - Find secure coding learning labs for specific vulnerabilities like XSS, SQL Injection, etc.
    - Explore OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and related labs
    - Provide additional resources and guides to help developers improve their secure coding skills

    Args:
        search: Search term for the vulnerability (e.g., 'xss', 'sql-injection', 'injection')
        cwe: Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) ID to filter by
        owasp: OWASP category to filter by (e.g., 'a03:2021')
        technology: Technology or framework to filter by (e.g., 'react', 'django')
        language: Programming language to filter by (e.g., 'javascript', 'python')

    Labs are secure coding challenges each simulating a real vulnerability. They are tagged with the following difficulty levels
        - Trivial: Easy to find and path vulnerabilities. It can be completed in 5-10 minutes. 1-15 points.
        - Easy: Known vulnerabilities. It can be completed in 10-30 minutes. 16-35 points.
        - Medium: Known vulnerabilities but require defence-in-depth patch. It can be completed in 20-30 minutes. 36-70 points.
        - Hard: Hard to find or patch vulnerabilities. It can be completed in 30-60 minutes. 71-100 points.
        - Battle: SecDim Flagship attack and defence challenge that require both vulnerability exploitation and mitigation skills. Points are accumulated.

    Returns:
        Dictionary containing labs results or error
        If there are no results, user can perform a manual search on https://play.secdim.com/browse

tools.name: search
tools.description:
Search for SecDim secure coding labs.

    This tool searches across SecDim's secure coding labs based on the search query.
    The backend API handles parsing of vulnerability names, CWE IDs, and OWASP IDs.

    Language can be specified using the format "lang:javascript".

    Args:
        query: Search query that may include:
               - Vulnerability names (e.g., "XSS", "SQL injection")
               - CWE IDs (e.g., "79")
               - OWASP IDs (e.g., "A03:2021")

               Examples:
               - "XSS lang:javascript" - searches for XSS labs in JavaScript
               - "SQL injection lang:Python" - searches for SQL injection labs in Python
               - "79" - searches for labs related to CWE-79

    Returns:
        Dictionary with search results containing:
        - results: List of matching labs with id, title, snippet, and metadata

tools.name: fetch
tools.description:
Fetch detailed content for a specific SecDim lab.

    Args:
        id: Lab ID in format "lab:slug" (e.g., "lab:xss-dom")

    Returns:
        Dictionary containing:
        - id: The lab ID
        - title: Lab title
        - content: Detailed content in markdown format
        - metadata: Additional lab information

tools.name: searchSymbol
tools.description: Easily find the ticker symbol of any stock with the FMP Stock Symbol Search API. Search by company name or symbol across multiple global markets.

query.description: The search query to find stock symbols

limit.description: Optional limit on number of results (default: 50)

tools.name: searchName
tools.description: Search for ticker symbols, company names, and exchange details for equity securities and ETFs listed on various exchanges with the FMP Name Search API. This endpoint is useful for retrieving ticker symbols when you know the full or partial company or asset name but not the symbol identifier.

query.description: The search query to find company names

limit.description: Optional limit on number of results (default: 50)

tools.name: searchCIK
tools.description: Easily retrieve the Central Index Key (CIK) for publicly traded companies with the FMP CIK API. Access unique identifiers needed for SEC filings and regulatory documents for a streamlined compliance and financial analysis process.

cik.description: The CIK number to search for

limit.description: Optional limit on number of results (default: 50)

tools.name: searchCUSIP
tools.description: Easily search and retrieve financial securities information by CUSIP number using the FMP CUSIP API. Find key details such as company name, stock symbol, and market capitalization associated with the CUSIP.

cusip.description: The CUSIP number to search for

tools.name: searchISIN
tools.description: Easily search and retrieve the International Securities Identification Number (ISIN) for financial securities using the FMP ISIN API. Find key details such as company name, stock symbol, and market capitalization associated with the ISIN.

isin.description: The ISIN number to search for

tools.description: Discover stocks that align with your investment strategy using the FMP Stock Screener API. Filter stocks based on market cap, price, volume, beta, sector, country, and more to identify the best opportunities.

marketCapMoreThan.description: Filter companies with market cap greater than this value

marketCapLowerThan.description: Filter companies with market cap less than this value

betaMoreThan.description: Filter companies with beta greater than this value

betaLowerThan.description: Filter companies with beta less than this value

priceMoreThan.description: Filter companies with price greater than this value

priceLowerThan.description: Filter companies with price less than this value

dividendMoreThan.description: Filter companies with dividend greater than this value

dividendLowerThan.description: Filter companies with dividend less than this value

volumeMoreThan.description: Filter companies with volume greater than this value

volumeLowerThan.description: Filter companies with volume less than this value
